properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 4 at 2:53PM MST until February 5 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Boise ID
properties.description:
...WINTER WEATHER LATE TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY...

.Moisture from the Gulf of Alaska will bring snow to east-central
Oregon and west-central Idaho beginning late tonight through
Thursday. Mountains will see moderate to heavy snowfall
accumulations. Mountain valleys below 4000 feet MSL will see
light to moderate snow accumulations during the event. Brief
freezing rain will be possible Wednesday afternoon as snow levels
rise, mainly across the Upper Weiser River area.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4
inches, except 8 to 12 inches over the mountains above 4000
feet MSL.

* WHERE...Baker County, Oregon.

* WHEN...From 10 PM this evening to 4 PM PST Wednesday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous
conditions could impact the Wednesday morning commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 PM PST WEDNESDAY
